LogDefinitionType.name: AcsNCTraceLog
LogDefinitionType.shortDescription: ACS trace logs for interaction with notification services/channels
LogDefinitionType.description: ACS uses these messages to log notification service related activities such as creating channels, subscribing to a channel etc.

LogDefinition.shortDescription: TAO extensions are not enabled.
LogDefinition.description: TAO extensions are not enabled. Since ACS 8.0, we require the NotifyService to offer the TAO specific extensions. Without those, we would need to program our own NC manager to prevent race conditions and to keep track of names and clients.

Member.name: ObjectName
Member.description: An optional name of the factory, channel, admin object etc which does not have the expected type.

Member.name: ExpectedType
Member.description: Expected TAO extension IDL type, e.g. 'IDL:sandia.gov/NotifyMonitoringExt/EventChannelFactory:1.0'

Member.name: ActualType
Member.description: Actual IDL type, e.g. 'IDL:omg.org/CosNotifyChannelAdmin/EventChannelFactory:1.0'

LogDefinition.shortDescription: About to create a notification channel
LogDefinition.description: About to create a notification channel

Member.name: ChannelName
Member.description: Name of the channel to be created.

Member.name: Service
Member.description: Name or ID of the notification service that should host the channel.

LogDefinition.shortDescription: Successfully created a notification channel, w/o configuration.
LogDefinition.description: Successfully created a notification channel, w/o configuration. Having this log message in addition to LOG_NC_ChannelCreated_OK is useful in order to measure performance bottlenecks in the various steps of NC creation.

Member.name: ChannelName
Member.description: Name of the channel created.

Member.name: ChannelId
Member.description: ID of the channel created.

Member.name: TimeMillis
Member.description: Elapsed time in ms for just the channel creation (call to NotifyFactory#create_named_channel)

LogDefinition.shortDescription: Successfully created and configured a notification channel.
LogDefinition.description: Successfully created and configured a notification channel.

Member.name: ChannelName
Member.description: Name of the channel created.

Member.name: ChannelId
Member.description: ID of the channel created.

Member.name: Service
Member.description: Name or ID of the notification service that hosts the channel.

Member.name: TimeMillis
Member.description: Elapsed time in ms, incl. channel configuration

LogDefinition.shortDescription: Successfully destroyed a notification channel
LogDefinition.description: Successfully destroyed a notification channel

Member.name: ChannelName
Member.description: Name of the channel destroyed.

Member.name: Service
Member.description: Name or ID of the notification service that hosted the channel.

LogDefinition.shortDescription: Successfully obtained a notification channel consumer admin object.
LogDefinition.description: Successfully obtained a notification channel consumer admin object, through creation or reuse.

Member.name: ConsumerAdminId
Member.description: ID of the admin object created.

Member.name: CreatedOrReused
Member.description: 'created' if admin object was created, 'reused' if an existing admin object was reused.

Member.name: ClientName
Member.description: Name of the client that created the consumer admin.

Member.name: ChannelName
Member.description: Name of the channel for which the ConsumerAdmin was created.

Member.name: Service
Member.description: Name or ID of the notification service that hosts the NC.

LogDefinition.shortDescription: Shared consumer admin object is handling more proxies than it should
LogDefinition.description: Shared consumer admin object has more push suppliers than it should, probably because a race condition was met by two simultaneous subscribers trying to acquire the same almost-full consumer admin.

Member.name: ConsumerAdminId
Member.description: ID of the admin object created.

Member.name: CurrentProxiesForAdmin
Member.description: Current number of proxies associated with the consumer admin.

Member.name: MaxProxiesPerAdmin
Member.description: Maximum expected number of proxies associated with this consumer admin.

Member.name: ChannelName
Member.description: Name of the channel for which the ConsumerAdmin was created.

Member.name: Service
Member.description: Name or ID of the notification service that hosts the NC.

LogDefinition.shortDescription: Successfully created a notification channel supplier proxy object.
LogDefinition.description: Successfully created a notification channel supplier proxy object, on behalf of the NC subscriber identified by 'ClientName'.

Member.name: SupplierProxyId
Member.description: System-provided ID of the supplier proxy object that was created.

Member.name: ClientName
Member.description: Name of the subscribing client that created the supplier proxy.

Member.name: ChannelName
Member.description: Name of the channel for which the supplier proxy was created.

Member.name: Service
Member.description: Name or ID of the notification service that hosts the NC.

LogDefinition.shortDescription: Failed to create a notification channel supplier proxy object.
LogDefinition.description: Failed to create a notification channel supplier proxy object on behalf of the NC subscriber identified by 'ClientName'.

Member.name: ClientName
Member.description: Name of the subscribing client that created the supplier proxy.

Member.name: ChannelName
Member.description: Name of the channel for which the supplier proxy was created.

Member.name: Service
Member.description: Name or ID of the notification service that hosts the NC.

Member.name: Reason
Member.description: Description of the reason for the failure.

LogDefinition.shortDescription: Successfully created a notification channel consumer proxy object.
LogDefinition.description: Successfully created a notification channel Consumer proxy object, on behalf of the NC supplier identified by 'ClientName'.

Member.name: ConsumerProxyId
Member.description: System-provided ID of the consumer proxy object that was created.

Member.name: ConsumerProxyName
Member.description: Application-provided name of the consumer proxy object that was created.

Member.name: ProxyCreationAttempts
Member.description: Creation attempts until a unique proxy name was found. Should almost always be '1' thanks to random number appended.

Member.name: ClientName
Member.description: Name of the publishing client that created the supplier proxy.

Member.name: ChannelName
Member.description: Name of the channel for which the consumer proxy was created.

Member.name: Service
Member.description: Name or ID of the notification service that hosts the NC.

LogDefinition.shortDescription: Failed to create a notification channel consumer proxy object.
LogDefinition.description: Failed to create a notification channel Consumer proxy object on behalf of the NC supplier identified by 'ClientName'.

Member.name: ClientName
Member.description: Name of the publishing client that created the supplier proxy.

Member.name: ChannelName
Member.description: Name of the channel for which the consumer proxy was created.

Member.name: Service
Member.description: Name or ID of the notification service that hosts the NC.

Member.name: Reason
Member.description: Description of the reason for the failure.

LogDefinition.shortDescription: Successfully connected to a notification channel
LogDefinition.description: Successfully connected to a notification channel

Member.name: ChannelName
Member.description: Name of the channel subscribed to.

Member.name: Service
Member.description: Name or ID of the notification service that hosts the channel.

LogDefinition.shortDescription: Failed connecting to a notification channel
LogDefinition.description: Failed connecting to a notification channel

Member.name: ChannelName
Member.description: Name of the channel not subscribed to.

Member.name: Service
Member.description: Name or ID of the notification service that hosts the channel.

LogDefinition.shortDescription: Disconnected from a notification channel
LogDefinition.description: Disconnected from a notification channel

Member.name: ChannelName
Member.description: Name of the channel subscribed to.

Member.name: Service
Member.description: Name or ID of the notification service that hosts the channel.

LogDefinition.shortDescription: Failed to disconnect from a notification channel
LogDefinition.description: Failed to disconnect from a notification channel. Perhaps resources could not be deallocated.

Member.name: ChannelName
Member.description: Name of the channel subscribed to.

Member.name: Service
Member.description: Name or ID of the notification service that hosts the channel.

LogDefinition.shortDescription: Event successfully received, ready to be processed
LogDefinition.description: Event successfully received, ready to be processed. The NC libraries will only log this message if the CDB enables event tracing for the particular channel, see 'IntegrationLogs' defined in EventChannel.xsd

Member.name: ChannelName
Member.description: Name of the channel subscribed to.

Member.name: Service
Member.description: Name or ID of the notification service that hosts the channel.

Member.name: EventName
Member.description: Name of the processed event.

LogDefinition.shortDescription: Received a corrupted event, which will not be processed.
LogDefinition.description: Received a corrupted event whose data was null or not a subtype of IDLEntity. Thus this event cannot be processed.

Member.name: ChannelName
Member.description: Name of the channel subscribed to.

Member.name: Service
Member.description: Name or ID of the notification service that hosts the channel.

Member.name: EventName
Member.description: Name of the processed event.

Member.name: EventDataType
Member.description: The offending event data type, or 'null'

LogDefinition.shortDescription: Event will be ignored because no registered receiver was found.
LogDefinition.description: An event was properly received, but no registered receiver was found, thus ACS will ignore this event. NC libs must carefully check whether event type filtering should be done in the NotifyService (then this is serious) or in the subscriber libraries (then this is normal), and adjust log level or use repeat guards accordingly.

Member.name: ChannelName
Member.description: Name of the channel subscribed to.

Member.name: Service
Member.description: Name or ID of the notification service that hosts the channel.

Member.name: EventName
Member.description: Name of the processed event.

LogDefinition.shortDescription: The registered event handler illegally threw an exception.
LogDefinition.description: Event handlers are not allowed to throw exceptions when they fail for whatever reason. If they do nonetheless, you see this log.

Member.name: ChannelName
Member.description: Name of the channel subscribed to.

Member.name: Service
Member.description: Name or ID of the notification service that hosts the channel.

Member.name: EventName
Member.description: Name of the processed event.

Member.name: HandlerClass
Member.description: The receiver class that let the exception fly through.

Member.name: ExceptionData
Member.description: Data about the caught exception.

LogDefinition.shortDescription: Took too long to process an event
LogDefinition.description: Took too long to process an event, considering the maxProcessTime attribute from the EventChannel schema. This is different from LOG_NC_ReceiverTooSlow which indicates an actual problem.

Member.name: ChannelName
Member.description: Name of the channel subscribed to.

Member.name: Service
Member.description: Name or ID of the notification service that hosts the channel.

Member.name: EventName
Member.description: Name of the processed event.

Member.name: LogOcurrencesNumber
Member.description: Number of previous LOG_NC_ProcessingTimeExceeded logs reduced into this single log by a repeat guard.

LogDefinition.shortDescription: More events came in from the NC than the receiver processed.
LogDefinition.description: More events came in from the NC than the receiver could process. The receiver must be changed to use its own queueing/discarding mechanism.

Member.name: ClientName
Member.description: Name of the client that failed to process events fast enough.

Member.name: NumEventsDiscarded
Member.description: Number of events discarded since the last log (log repeat guard used).

Member.name: EventName
Member.description: Name of the last event that could not be handled immediately.

Member.name: ChannelName
Member.description: Name of the channel subscribed to.

Member.name: Service
Member.description: Name or ID of the notification service that hosts the channel.

Member.name: LogOcurrencesNumber
Member.description: Number of previous LOG_NC_ReceiverTooSlow logs reduced into this single log by a repeat guard.
